title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
CalebJamesDeLisl left at 04:33 (  
xwiki-bridge - (06:04): [Lady Serena Kitty] in the charting plugin, the renderer option has no effect  
xwiki-bridge - (07:24): [asirir] (01/04/2010 10:34:33 AM) Lady Serena Kitty: for charting you can use http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Macros/ChartMacro20. Not sure if this is what you want.  
xwiki-bridge - (07:24): [Lady Serena Kitty] I know, but I want the bars to be horizontal.  
xwiki-bridge - (07:25): [Lady Serena Kitty] looks like even with the old chart macro, I can't get them to be horizontal  
xwiki-bridge - (07:27): [asirir] checking  
xwiki-bridge - (07:32): [Lady Serena Kitty] I looked in the sources, and the constants for the different renderers are there, they just aren't bound  
xwiki-bridge - (07:34): [asirir] yup, seems not possible.  
xwiki-bridge - (07:43): [Cindy Mitchell] o.o  Jessica, we're going to be using those for what, our stats and stuff?  
xwiki-bridge - (07:44): [Lady Serena Kitty] http://admin.ladyserenakitty.com/bin/ServerFund  
plunden joined #xwiki at 08:15  
LadySerena joined #xwiki at 08:32  
xwiki-bridge - (08:51): [Cindy Mitchell] How can I find out which groups a user is in?  
xwiki-bridge - (08:54): [Vincent Massol] Cindy Mitchell: hi. I don't think you can right now or at least not easily. I'm not sure though since I don't know that part well. What you can do is test whether a user a right to do something though  
xwiki-bridge - (08:55): [Cindy Mitchell] Ah.  
xwiki-bridge - (08:55): [Vincent Massol] you could ask on the list and get a better answer though  
xwiki-bridge - (08:55): [Vincent Massol] bb in 2 minutes  
kibahop joined #xwiki at 09:02  
kibahop left #xwiki at 09:03  
xwiki-bridge - (09:03): [Cindy Mitchell] I found it.  
xwiki-bridge - (09:03): [Cindy Mitchell] $xwiki.user.isUserInGroup()  
xwiki-bridge - (09:04): [Vincent Massol] yes but that's different from what you were asking  
xwiki-bridge - (09:04): [Vincent Massol] :)  
xwiki-bridge - (09:04): [Vincent Massol] if it fills your need then good though  
xwiki-bridge - (09:04): [Cindy Mitchell] yeah, well I just changed what I wanted. :P  
xwiki-bridge - (09:33): [Vincent Massol] silviar: hi  
xwiki-bridge - (09:34): [Vincent Massol] re manual testing plan, we need to decide if we want to duplicate automated testing or not IMO  
xwiki-bridge - (09:35): [Vincent Massol] hmm since you have different browsers and since our automated tests are not done on all browsers yes I'd propose that we mention in the manual test plan when an automated test exist in the cell  
xwiki-bridge - (09:35): [Vincent Massol] wdyt?  
xwiki-bridge - (09:36): [Vincent Massol] for ex on http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Drafts/TestingRegisterLoginLogout, you could fill some cells under FF with "AT" or some image (AT would stand for Automated Test)  
xwiki-bridge - (09:36): [Vincent Massol] I think it's important to know where we have automated tests already  
xwiki-bridge - (09:36): [Vincent Massol] for 2 reasons:  
xwiki-bridge - (09:37): [Vincent Massol] 1) it allows to see where we don't have automated tests and thus let us create more automated tests  
xwiki-bridge - (09:37): [Vincent Massol] 2) it makes manual tests faster since we don't need to retest those  
xwiki-bridge - (09:37): [Vincent Massol] wdyt?  
kibahop joined #xwiki at 09:40  
xwiki-bridge - (09:40): [Vincent Massol] silviar: also fyi the tests for register are here: http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/enterprise/trunk/distribution-test/selenium-tests/src/test/it/com/xpn/xwiki/it/selenium/RegisterTest.java  
xwiki-bridge - (09:40): [Vincent Massol] and the tests for login/logout: http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/enterprise/trunk/distribution-test/selenium-tests/src/test/it/com/xpn/xwiki/it/selenium/LoginLogoutTest.java  
xwiki-bridge - (09:41): [Vincent Massol] another question: is the goal of the manual test plan to be comprehensive or to cover only important features and only happy cases for those?  
xwiki-bridge - (09:42): [silviar] Mentioning the automated tests sounds very good. This is will help prioritize  
xwiki-bridge - (09:44): [silviar] The manual test plan should cover the most important features; For further testing we could have another separate page where more advanced scenarios could be included  
xwiki-bridge - (09:44): [silviar] like Guillaume did here with the WYSIWYG  
xwiki-bridge - (09:44): [silviar] http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/ManualTestPlan  
xwiki-bridge - (09:45): [silviar] \*this will  
xwiki-bridge - (09:45): [Vincent Massol] ok. Would be great if you could add those 2 points to the description of the manual test plan somewhere  
xwiki-bridge - (09:46): [Vincent Massol] Point 1: about mentioning the automated tests  
xwiki-bridge - (09:46): [Vincent Massol] Point 2: about the scope of the manual test plan  
xwiki-bridge - (09:46): [Vincent Massol] maybe it's there already?  
arkub joined #xwiki at 09:46  
xwiki-bridge - (09:46): [silviar] There is a mention of the scope of the test plan in the begining  
xwiki-bridge - (09:46): [Vincent Massol] what's the link already?  
xwiki-bridge - (09:47): [Vincent Massol] oh you just gave it :)  
xwiki-bridge - (09:47): [Vincent Massol] hmm no  
xwiki-bridge - (09:47): [silviar] http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Drafts/ManualTestingPlan/  
xwiki-bridge - (09:47): [Vincent Massol] this link http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/ManualTestPlan says the opposite  
xwiki-bridge - (09:47): [silviar] In there begining in italics  
xwiki-bridge - (09:47): [Vincent Massol] ah there are 2 pages  
xwiki-bridge - (09:48): [silviar] The first link was to give an idea as to how the comprehensive additional testing pages will look like  
xwiki-bridge - (09:48): [silviar] the second is the draft for the basic testing  
xwiki-bridge - (09:48): [silviar] with the mention of the scope in italics  
xwiki-bridge - (09:49): [Vincent Massol] ok you'll need to refactor the 2 pages into one probably when you're done and move from draft to there  
xwiki-bridge - (09:49): [Vincent Massol] there = Community space  
xwiki-bridge - (09:49): [Vincent Massol] guillaume's page is probably now obsolete in some parts  
xwiki-bridge - (09:49): [Vincent Massol] since it doesn't represent the full manual test plan but only some wysiwyg part  
xwiki-bridge - (09:49): [silviar] Yes. The plan is to 1) Finish the draft for the manual testing 2) Include mentions of the automated tests 3) Move the pages to the final documentation  
xwiki-bridge - (09:49): [Vincent Massol] great  
bbc581 joined #xwiki at 09:51  
xwiki-bridge - (09:51): [silviar] Guillaume's page will be brought up to date and become a supbage of WYSIWYG testing  
xwiki-bridge - (09:52): [Vincent Massol] ok  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 10:06  
lucaa left #xwiki at 10:07  
xwiki-bridge - (10:15): [Vincent Massol] bad doc name  
xwiki-bridge - (10:15): [Vincent Massol] :)  
xwiki-bridge - (10:15): [silviar] noticed :)  
bbc581 left at 10:19 (Client Quit  
xwiki-bridge - (10:20): [silviar] Should notifications for minor changes to docs on xwiki.org appear on jabber?  
bbc581 joined #xwiki at 10:21  
xwiki-bridge - (10:24): [Vincent Massol] silviar: it's a question I've asked myself but I answered yes when I coded the bot. The reason is that I thought it was nicer to see everything going on, someone could spam the wiki with minor notifications for ex, etc  
xwiki-bridge - (10:25): [Vincent Massol] in some future what I'd like is to have a monitoring app  
xwiki-bridge - (10:25): [Vincent Massol] in xeclipse for ex  
xwiki-bridge - (10:25): [Vincent Massol] where you can choose which notifications you wish to receive  
xwiki-bridge - (10:25): [Vincent Massol] (using distributed events)  
xwiki-bridge - (10:26): [Vincent Massol] so that you can follow whatever happens in the wiki in real time  
xwiki-bridge - (10:26): [silviar] ok; I only asked because I don't want to spam the chat with the changes/additions I make  
xwiki-bridge - (10:26): [Vincent Massol] when the level of "spam" will be too high we could have a special channel for notifications  
xwiki-bridge - (10:26): [Vincent Massol] and only people interested would be on this channel  
xwiki-bridge - (10:27): [silviar] sounds good  
KermitTheFragger joined #xwiki at 10:39  
xwiki-bridge - (10:41): [Vincent Massol] almost done with my model references stuff…. will be committing soon but the next step will be to review all places that manipulate references to ensure the code is ok and to ensure they use the new factories/serializer  
xwiki-bridge - (10:42): [Vincent Massol] tmortagne: ok with my last mail about relative vs absolute?  
xwiki-bridge - (10:42): [tmortagne] Vincent Massol: did not gone this far in Gmail yet, i'm looking  
xwiki-bridge - (10:45): [tmortagne] Vincent Massol: answered (+1)  
xwiki-bridge - (10:45): [Vincent Massol] pfeww….  
xwiki-bridge - (10:45): [Vincent Massol] :)  
xwiki-bridge - (10:46): [tmortagne] i was thinking it was becoming too complicated with relative references  
xwiki-bridge - (10:46): [Vincent Massol] yep  
xwiki-bridge - (10:47): [tmortagne] for Eclipse+ubuntu users: 3.6 works well and support better new version of GTK introduced by Ubuntu 9.10 (like bug with button impossible to click in Eclipse 3.5)  
xwiki-bridge - (10:48): [Vincent Massol] btw m2e is almost final  
xwiki-bridge - (10:48): [Vincent Massol] haven't tried the latest dev build though  
xwiki-bridge - (10:48): [tmortagne] works well too  
xwiki-bridge - (10:48): [tmortagne] tested it with my new 3.6 install  
xwiki-bridge - (10:49): [lucaa] tmortagne: good news. if only eclipse had a simpler way to upgrade...  
xwiki-bridge - (10:49): [tmortagne] seems to not have issues I used to have with 0.9.9  
xwiki-bridge - (10:50): [tmortagne] lucaa: yes even for the same version i regularly have to recreate Eclipse install  
xwiki-bridge - (10:50): [Vincent Massol] tmortagne: they say they've fixed the issue I reported with resource files not picked up (I've seen the jira issuec losed)  
xwiki-bridge - (10:51): [tmortagne] Vincent Massol: great that was the main m2eclipse all versions issue  
xwiki-bridge - (11:00): [Cindy Mitchell] I want news posts on the main page; is there a way I can pull in a post and parse it as news?   
xwiki-bridge - (11:01): [sdumitriu] Pull it from where?  
xwiki-bridge - (11:01): [Cindy Mitchell] another wiki page  
xwiki-bridge - (11:01): [sdumitriu] You mean something like the blog app?  
xwiki-bridge - (11:01): [sdumitriu] Sure it's possible  
xwiki-bridge - (11:01): [sdumitriu] Anything is possible in XWiki  
xwiki-bridge - (11:02): [Cindy Mitchell] I want like a hidden wiki page that contains "front page" posts which can be parsed and displayed as news articles.  
xwiki-bridge - (11:02): [sdumitriu] As long as you code it  
xwiki-bridge - (11:03): [Cindy Mitchell] well, not so much a blog  
xwiki-bridge - (11:03): [Cindy Mitchell] I'm not looking for people to comment on the news :P  
xwiki-bridge - (11:03): [Cindy Mitchell] I just want a way to display news without hard-coding it.  
xwiki-bridge - (11:05): [Cindy Mitchell] hm  
xwiki-bridge - (11:05): [sdumitriu] You can just write document names in a wiki page and do something like:  
xwiki-bridge - (11:05): [sdumitriu] foreach line in xwiki.getDocument('Main.NewsIndex').content.split  
xwiki-bridge - (11:05): [sdumitriu]   {{include document="$line"/}}  
xwiki-bridge - (11:05): [sdumitriu] end  
xwiki-bridge - (11:05): [Cindy Mitchell] hm  
xwiki-bridge - (11:06): [Vincent Massol] you can also tag them with a "news" tag  
xwiki-bridge - (11:07): [Vincent Massol] and then use the search api to find all pages with that news tag  
xwiki-bridge - (11:07): [Vincent Massol] depends on your needs  
xwiki-bridge - (11:09): [Cindy Mitchell] hm  
xwiki-bridge - (11:11): [lucaa] Vincent Massol: re absolute vs relative, my usecase when I needed the parsing the in wysiwyg, was for the link plugin, namely for editing links. I needed to parse a link's target when editing (so that I set the current selection in the link dialogs) but needed to leave it unchanged in case the user doesn't edit it so i needed its original form. However, this can be implemented also without relative refs, I just  
xwiki-bridge - (11:11): [lucaa] it might inspire another usecase  
xwiki-bridge - (11:12): [Cindy Mitchell] how do I use the search api?  
xwiki-bridge - (11:12): [Vincent Massol] lucaa: yes you could save the original string in case it's not changed  
xwiki-bridge - (11:13): [lucaa] Vincent Massol: yes, something like that. Basically i only need the original serialization as relative, not the reference object/model itself  
xwiki-bridge - (11:14): [Vincent Massol] relative serailization already exists in my impl of the compact serializer  
xwiki-bridge - (11:14): [lucaa] as relative or absolute or whatever was the original, i meant  
xwiki-bridge - (11:15): [Cindy Mitchell] Can I theme the admin panel separately from the front page?  
xwiki-bridge - (11:15): [asirir] devs, did someone updage xhtml validity tests recently? in http://hudson.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-product-enterprise-tests/com.xpn.xwiki.products$xwiki-enterprise-test-webstandards/ I see failed tests from build #325 to #328 but no changes to code..  
xwiki-bridge - (11:15): [Vincent Massol] as long as you don't absolutely require relatvie reference we're fine :)  
xwiki-bridge - (11:15): [lucaa] no, I don't. I reimplement everything there anyway, so I don't really require anything :)  
xwiki-bridge - (11:15): [Vincent Massol] :)  
xwiki-bridge - (11:16): [lucaa] it was just for the usecase  
xwiki-bridge - (11:16): [lucaa] type of usecase,maybe there could be something similar, etc  
xwiki-bridge - (11:18): [Cindy Mitchell] how do I create a Space in my wiki, when I don't have the admin menu up top?  
xwiki-bridge - (11:19): [lucaa] Cindy Mitchell: you create a page in that space, for example the space home: Space.WebHome  
xwiki-bridge - (11:23): [Cindy Mitchell] Oh, just any page?  
xwiki-bridge - (11:24): [sdumitriu] Yep, any  
xwiki-bridge - (11:24): [sdumitriu] There's no space entity  
xwiki-bridge - (11:31): [Vincent Massol] hmmm it seems we have the use case where we would want to use the default factory (or normalizer) but only for space and page and not for the wiki part...  
xwiki-bridge - (11:32): [Vincent Massol] tmortagne: is that a valid use case, wdyt?  
xwiki-bridge - (11:32): [Vincent Massol] for ex mariusF does this in the gwt service:  
xwiki-bridge - (11:32): [Vincent Massol]         String newPageName = StringUtils.isEmpty(page) ? "WebHome" : clearXWikiName(page);  
xwiki-bridge - (11:33): [Vincent Massol]         String newSpaceName = StringUtils.isEmpty(space) ? "Main" : clearXWikiName(space);  
xwiki-bridge - (11:33): [Vincent Massol]         String newWikiName = StringUtils.isEmpty(wiki) ? getXWikiContext().getDatabase() : clearXWikiName(wiki);  
xwiki-bridge - (11:33): [Vincent Massol]         return new DocumentReference(newWikiName, newSpaceName, newPageName);  
xwiki-bridge - (11:33): [Vincent Massol] I'm replacing it with the default normalizer  
xwiki-bridge - (11:33): [Vincent Massol] but the default normalizer will use "xwiki" as the db name  
xwiki-bridge - (11:33): [Vincent Massol] (or whatever it's been configured as)  
xwiki-bridge - (11:34): [tmortagne] there is code for the wiki in the code you pasted, i'm not sure to understand what is the issue exactly  
xwiki-bridge - (11:35): [tmortagne] hmm you mean use "default" space and "current" wiki when normalize  
xwiki-bridge - (11:35): [tmortagne] the mix ?  
xwiki-bridge - (11:35): [Vincent Massol] yes  
xwiki-bridge - (11:35): [Vincent Massol] right now I have only 2 normalizer/factories  
xwiki-bridge - (11:35): [Vincent Massol] all default or all current  
xwiki-bridge - (11:36): [Vincent Massol] I was wondernig if we need a new one  
xwiki-bridge - (11:36): [Vincent Massol] (which would do a mix)  
xwiki-bridge - (11:36): [tmortagne] well this use case is weird, why are we doing that in GWT ?  
xwiki-bridge - (11:36): [Vincent Massol]         // Note: we use the default normalizer instead of the current normalizer because the execution context in which  
xwiki-bridge - (11:36): [Vincent Massol]         // this component is used doesn't have a current document. This component is used to respond to GWT-RPC requests  
xwiki-bridge - (11:36): [Vincent Massol]         // which don't have the information required to detect the current document (e.g. these informations can't be  
xwiki-bridge - (11:36): [Vincent Massol]         // extracted from the request URL).  
xwiki-bridge - (11:37): [Vincent Massol] (this is the comment from marius that I have started modifying)  
xwiki-bridge - (11:37): [Vincent Massol] (the part till "normalizer" is from me)  
xwiki-bridge - (11:37): [tmortagne] so it's a hack because ther eis no current document, then the solution is to put a current document  
xwiki-bridge - (11:38): [Vincent Massol] indeed that's a solution  
xwiki-bridge - (11:39): [Vincent Massol] I need to offer an easy way to get access to the default document reference  
xwiki-bridge - (11:39): [Vincent Massol] hmm that can be done with the default normalizer  
xwiki-bridge - (11:40): [Vincent Massol] but maybe overkill  
xwiki-bridge - (11:40): [Vincent Massol] otherwise users need to use ModelConfiguration.String getDefaultReferenceName(EntityType type);  
xwiki-bridge - (11:40): [Vincent Massol] it's not that bad either  
xwiki-bridge - (11:40): [Vincent Massol] I could just make it a tad easier  
xwiki-bridge - (11:41): [Vincent Massol] new DocumentReference(configuration.getDefaultReferenceName(EntityType.WIKI), …);  
xwiki-bridge - (11:41): [Vincent Massol] ok I'll leave it to marius to refactor....  
xwiki-bridge - (11:42): [Vincent Massol] for his code  
xwiki-bridge - (11:42): [sdumitriu] Vincent  
xwiki-bridge - (11:43): [sdumitriu] Does this mean that when we write an application, all the references will be hardcoded to the owner wiki?  
xwiki-bridge - (11:43): [sdumitriu] Making it hard to import an application in another wiki?  
xwiki-bridge - (11:44): [Vincent Massol] references?  
xwiki-bridge - (11:44): [Vincent Massol] the user writes the links  
xwiki-bridge - (11:44): [sdumitriu] Yep, {{include document="xwiki:Blog.BlogCode"/}}  
xwiki-bridge - (11:44): [Vincent Massol] so the user decides what to use  
xwiki-bridge - (11:44): [Vincent Massol] if you rename  
xwiki-bridge - (11:45): [Vincent Massol] the rename impl uses the compact serializer  
xwiki-bridge - (11:45): [Vincent Massol] which uses the shortest possible string reference  
xwiki-bridge - (11:45): [Vincent Massol] what's your use case?  
xwiki-bridge - (11:45): [Vincent Massol] rename? something else?  
xwiki-bridge - (11:45): [sdumitriu] Using an include from the WISYWIG  
xwiki-bridge - (11:46): [Vincent Massol] I don't know, anca would know  
xwiki-bridge - (11:46): [sdumitriu] Writing a link from the WYSIWYG  
xwiki-bridge - (11:46): [Vincent Massol] depends what serializer she uses  
xwiki-bridge - (11:48): [sdumitriu] (11:33:07 AM) Vincent Massol: I'm replacing it with the default normalizer  
xwiki-bridge - (11:48): [sdumitriu] (11:33:17 AM) Vincent Massol: but the default normalizer will use "xwiki" as the db name  
xwiki-bridge - (11:48): [Vincent Massol] this is not about serialization  
xwiki-bridge - (11:48): [Vincent Massol] it's about factory  
xwiki-bridge - (11:48): [Vincent Massol] (the opposite)  
xwiki-bridge - (11:49): [sdumitriu] I read that as "whetever document references are created from GWT, they will be fully prefixed  
xwiki-bridge - (11:49): [sdumitriu] I read wrong?  
xwiki-bridge - (11:49): [Vincent Massol] internally we only have absolute refs  
xwiki-bridge - (11:49): [Vincent Massol] it's only the serializer used that then decide to print the full ref or a relative one  
xwiki-bridge - (11:49): [Vincent Massol] yes you read wrong I think  
xwiki-bridge - (11:50): [Vincent Massol] well you read correctly but only half of the story ;)  
xwiki-bridge - (11:50): [Vincent Massol] document refs are indeed created as absolute   
xwiki-bridge - (11:55): [Vincent Massol] sdumitriu: after I'm done with the commit we need to review all places manipulating references to ensure default/current are used properly and to ensure the new model api is used  
xwiki-bridge - (11:56): [Vincent Massol] I'm pretty sure I'm introducing several issues  
kibahop left #xwiki at 12:12  
sunny\_slls joined #xwiki at 13:06

xwiki-bridge - (13:50): [sdumitriu] evalica: I did some commits introducing the color theme in existing UIs  
xwiki-bridge - (13:50): [sdumitriu] You should check if the colors are OK  
xwiki-bridge - (13:50): [sdumitriu] Since I replaced custom colors with standard ones  
xwiki-bridge - (13:52): [evalica] sdumitriu: k  
xwiki-bridge - (13:52): [evalica] sdumitriu: k  
Lukemon\_ left at 13:56 (Read error: 60 (Operation timed out)  
sunny\_slls - (14:04): good evening xwiki-bridge sdumitriu  
sunny\_slls - (14:04): xwiki-bridge, http://pastebin.com/m3cc8c847  
xwiki-bridge - (14:05): [Vincent Massol] sunny: his name is sdumitriu…. not xwiki-bridge ;)  
sunny\_slls - (14:05): when i execute this program the output is no way ? why?  
sunny\_slls - (14:05): :)  
xwiki-bridge - (14:05): [sdumitriu] Well, did you define $s?  
sunny\_slls - (14:05): output is "no way"  
sunny\_slls - (14:05): nope  
xwiki-bridge - (14:05): [sdumitriu] Then it's normal  
xwiki-bridge - (14:05): [Vincent Massol] it's #else  
xwiki-bridge - (14:05): [sdumitriu] $s is not 1  
sunny\_slls - (14:06): but by default what value is it assuming?  
sunny\_slls - (14:06): of $s  
sunny\_slls - (14:07): oh! i got it  
sunny\_slls - (14:07): sorry  
xwiki-bridge - (14:14): [sdumitriu] $s is undefined, null  
sunny\_slls - (14:27): sdumitriu, http://pastebin.com/m36f52254  
sunny\_slls - (14:27): its giving an error macro.MacroExecutionException  
sunny\_slls - (14:27): throwing an exception why?  
xwiki-bridge - (14:28): [Vincent Massol] click on the red error  
xwiki-bridge - (14:28): [Vincent Massol] you'll get the explanation  
xwiki-bridge - (14:28): [Vincent Massol] my guess is that your velocity is invalid  
xwiki-bridge - (14:29): [Vincent Massol] for the velocity user guide you can read: http://velocity.apache.org/engine/releases/velocity-1.6.2/user-guide.html  
xwiki-bridge - (14:29): [evalica] #set( $monkey.Say = ["Not", $my, "fault ] )  
xwiki-bridge - (14:29): [evalica] mises a "  ?  
xwiki-bridge - (14:29): [evalica] on fault  
xwiki-bridge - (14:38): [Vincent Massol] guys we've missed the 2.2M1 release  
xwiki-bridge - (14:38): [Vincent Massol] it was planned for the 28th of Dec  
xwiki-bridge - (14:38): [glerouge] we know  
xwiki-bridge - (14:38): [glerouge] all release managers were on holiday  
xwiki-bridge - (14:39): [Vincent Massol] the question is what do we do. I have a huge change to commit (the new model stuff)  
xwiki-bridge - (14:39): [Vincent Massol] but if I commit it it means I need  1 more week to ensure things will continue to work  
xwiki-bridge - (14:41): [Vincent Massol] so choice 1) we commit now with what we have and choice 2) we postpone the release for next Monday  
xwiki-bridge - (14:41): [Vincent Massol] wdyt?  
xwiki-bridge - (14:44): [glerouge] we're late already
